page.title: 09NEW HOSPITAL IN CALOW
page.content: The first part of the new General Hospital was opened in March 1985. It is built where Plover Hill Farm at Calow used to be. This part has accident and emergency units,operating theatres,Xray,therapy units, medical,surgical, and childrens wards. We can see the top of the chimney of the boiler house from school,but soon this will be hidden when the trees they are planting grow bigger. Now they are building more childrens wards,a unit for old people,maternity wards and units for the mentally ill. When it is finished about 350,000 people,in Chesterfield and N.E.Derbys. will use it.It should provide nearly all the services we need.
